cards.title: The Late-Night “Seen”
cards.scenario: You send a light message. They read it… and don't reply. You notice the “seen” timestamp. It's been a couple of hours. What do you do?

behaviours.label: I don't chase it. I carry on with my night.
I send a casual follow-up later (“All good?”).
I pull back and match their energy going forward.
I stay warm next time we speak, without referencing it.

interpretations.label: They got distracted; it's nothing.
That's a signal. I notice reliability patterns.
It stings; I want to feel chosen.
If it's real, it won't need managing.

cards.title: The Distracted Dinner
cards.scenario: You're sitting together in your favourite restaurant, and they keep checking their phone. They're present, but not fully. How do you respond?

behaviours.label: I stay grounded and enjoy the moment anyway.
I ask gently, “Everything okay?”
I withdraw a bit and let the moment cool.
I stay warm but redirect: “Let's be here for a bit.”

interpretations.label: Could be work/family; not about me.
Attention is a form of respect; I clock this.
I feel small when I'm not the priority.
The right connection feels naturally present.

cards.title: The Last-Minute Change
cards.scenario: You had a plan. They change at late notice - time, place, or cancel. It's inconvenient, and you were looking forward to it. What do you do?

behaviours.label: I adapt and replan calmly.
I check in: “All good? What's come up?”
I step back and let them reset things.
I stay warm and suggest an alternative that works for me.

interpretations.label: Life happens; flexibility is normal.
Consistency matters. This is data.
I feel disregarded; it hits a nerve.
If it's solid, it survives small disruptions.

cards.title: The Social Media Moment
cards.scenario: They've been quiet with you… but you see them posting stories, out and about. No mention, no reply. What's your move?

behaviours.label: I don't react. I keep my own rhythm.
I send a light check-in, no accusation.
I disengage and let them come to me.
I stay warm, but I stop over-investing.

interpretations.label: Posting isn't the same as communicating.
If they can post, they can reply; I note it.
I feel replaceable; I want reassurance.
I don't want to compete for basic effort.

cards.title: The Clean Compliment
cards.scenario: They compliment you directly - something specific and sincere. It lands. You feel seen. How do you respond?

behaviours.label: I receive it openly: “Thank you.”
I deflect with humour, then soften.
I accept it but get shy/guarded.
I return warmth in a grounded way.

interpretations.label: Kindness is simple and good.
This suggests deeper intention.
Affection opens me up… and scares me.
Healthy connection is reciprocal and steady.

cards.title: The Small Boundary
cards.scenario: After a day of flirty messaging, you suggest a call tonight. They reply: “Not tonight - I'm wiped. Tomorrow?” What do you do?

behaviours.label: I say “No worries” and move on.
I reply warmly and confirm a time tomorrow.
I pull back and wait for them to follow through.
I stay warm but keep plans flexible on my side.

interpretations.label: They're tired; it's normal.
Follow-through matters; tomorrow will tell me.
My insecurity lights up when I'm deprioritised.
Good pacing includes rest and boundaries.

cards.title: The Vulnerable Share
cards.scenario: They open up about something personal - family, a past relationship, or something they've been carrying. It's real. There's weight in it. How do you respond?

behaviours.label: I meet it with care and presence.
I validate them and share something small too.
I listen, but I keep emotional distance.
I support gently without trying to fix it.

interpretations.label: Vulnerability is part of connection.
This is significant; I don't take it lightly.
Intimacy pulls me in and makes me anxious.
People open at different speeds; I can hold that.

cards.title: The Joke That Lands Wrong
cards.scenario: They make a joke that stings. They don't mean harm, but you feel the edge. What do you do?

behaviours.label: I let it go and don't escalate.
I name it calmly: “That didn't land for me.”
I go quiet and pull back.
I stay warm but set a light boundary.

interpretations.label: Misfires happen; no big deal.
Humour can reveal values; I pay attention.
It hits a sensitive spot in me.
Respect should feel natural, not negotiated.

cards.title: The “What Are We?” Moment
cards.scenario: You've been seeing each other for a while. They say something vague about the future - not quite committing, not quite leaving. How do you respond?

behaviours.label: I stay calm and let time show me.
I ask directly (but kindly) what they want.
I step back to protect myself.
I stay warm, but I don't invest further without clarity.

interpretations.label: Some people move slowly; it's okay.
Ambiguity is information; I don't ignore it.
Uncertainty makes me feel unsafe.
The right thing becomes clear with consistency.

cards.title: The Apology Test
cards.scenario: They apologise for something - late, careless, or a crossed line. They say, “I'm sorry. I'll do better.” How do you respond?

behaviours.label: I accept it and move forward.
I ask what “do better” looks like concretely.
I stay guarded; words aren't enough.
I accept warmly, but I watch their actions.

interpretations.label: People mess up; repair matters.
Accountability is a core signal.
I want to believe them, but I'm wary.
Consistency will tell the truth.

cards.title: The Space Request
cards.scenario: Just as it's starting to feel real, they say: “I need a bit of space this week.” How does this land?

behaviours.label: I respect it and keep my life moving.
I ask gently what “space” means for them.
I pull back fully and detach.
I give space but keep a light, warm thread.

interpretations.label: Space is healthy; it's normal.
Space can be distance; I take note.
It triggers fear of being left.
Healthy connection can breathe without breaking.

cards.title: The Steady Love (The Scary Good)
cards.scenario: They're consistent. They follow through. They show you they like you. No games. No hot-and-cold. How does it feel?

behaviours.label: I let it be good and stay steady.
I reciprocate and express appreciation.
I go cautiously; part of me hesitates.
I lean in warmly, without overthinking.

interpretations.label: Consistency feels safe.
This is what I value: stability and effort.
I'm hopeful, but old fears whisper.
The right thing feels simple and mutual.
